events.name: Seminar @ NTU SBS : ibidi – cells in focus: How to combine cell culture and cell based assays with high end microscopy
events.description:
Untitled Document 
 
Abstract 
Long-term imaging of living cells is an increasingly important technique in cell biology. Only during live cell imaging, cellular dynamics such as cytoskeletal rearrangements, migration and chemotactic behavior of the cell can be properly investigated. Therefore, it is crucial to provide in vivo near environmental conditions by controlling the pH as well as humidity and temperature. Especially in cancer and stem cell biology it is fundamental to conduct experiments under more physiological, hence hypoxic conditions. Further, sample preparation including the right surface for cell attachment is an important step in live cell imaging. 
ibidi’s research is focused on the development of functional cell based assays such as migration, chemotaxis and angiogenesis. Scientific applications and results from these fields will be presented. 
Details 
26 Mar 2015 (Tue), 10.30am - 11.30am  Nanyang Technological University, School of Biological Sciences,  SBS-01n-22, Classroom 2  
Refreshments will be served. 
Speaker 
Dr. Tina Freisinger  Application Specialist  ibidi 
Tina Freisinger studied Biology in Munich and Edinburgh and pursued a PhD with a focus on cell biology and imaging at the Max Planck Institute of Biochemistry in Munich. After receiving her PhD in 2012, Tina stayed on in the same lab as a postdoc and worked on a drug discovery project in collaboration with Novartis. After a 6-month marketing and sales internship at AMGEN, Tina joined ibidi as a global application specialist in October 2013. 
Enquire 
Evelyn Wong 
Email: evelyn@sciencewerke.com 
Contact No: +65 9835 3702
events.location: Nanyang Technological University, School of Biological Sciences, , 60 Nanyang Drive, SBS-01n-22, Classroom 2, Singapore 637551

events.name: Seminar @ MBI: ibidi - cells in focus: Cell cultivation under flow and solutions for high-end imaging of living cells
events.description:
Abstract 
Several adherent cell types are exposed to shear stress conditions in vivo, e.g. endothelial cells in a blood vessel. Culturing cells in vitro under perfusion conditions simulates this mechanical stimulus and induces a more physiological behavior. Besides the simulation of shear stress, the control of other environmental parameters such as temperature, humidity, pH and oxygen are crucial for long-term cultivation and imaging of living cells. ibidi’s research is aimed on integrating cell culture with high-end microscopy as well as the development of functional cell based assays such as migration, chemotaxis, angiogenesis. In this seminar, the focus will be on perfusion assays and the biological impact of shear stress on cells. Scientific applications and results from this field will be presented. 
Details 
26 Mar 2015 (Thu), 2pm - 3pm  National University of Singapore,  Mechanobiology Institute, T-Lab Building  Level 5 Meeting Room  
Refreshments will be served. 
Speaker 
Dr. Tina Freisinger  Application Specialist  ibidi 
Tina Freisinger studied Biology in Munich and Edinburgh and pursued a PhD with a focus on cell biology and imaging at the Max Planck Institute of Biochemistry in Munich. After receiving her PhD in 2012, Tina stayed on in the same lab as a postdoc and worked on a drug discovery project in collaboration with Novartis. After a 6-month marketing and sales internship at AMGEN, Tina joined ibidi as a global application specialist in October 2013. 
Enquire 
Leonard Lim 
Email: leonard@sciencewerke.com 
Contact No: +65 9018 3679
events.location: National University of Singapore, , Mechanobiology Institute, T-Lab Building Level 5 Meeting Room, Singapore 117411

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm 2015:time:space: By Robert Casteels 8pm and 9pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 2015:time:space: is a collaborative work of voices, electronic instruments, live processing, tape and video. New electronic instruments are altered in real time, fusing effortlessly with the human voice. Projected against this kaleidoscope of sound will be stunning pre-recorded images of Singapore, tying in sounds from humanity to the technology of our modern world, crossing time and space. 2015:time:space: is an original production that is generously supported by the National Arts Council. Entry is complimentary and on a first come first served basis. The full line-up of ArtScience Late until March 2015 can be viewed here: http://bit.ly/artsciencelate

events.name: March Meetup
events.description: Another month, another meetup! This time it'll be on the 26th of March at the ThoughtWorks' office. Venue: 87B Amoy Street #03/04, Singapore 069906, Singapore We're still looking for one more 10-15 minute talk, if you're interested please contact us! PyCon Singapore is going to be June 17th to 19th and the call for proposals is up on the website, if you have something to share then please sign up! https://pycon.sg/proposals/ -------------- Talks 1. "Getting started with testing using Pytest and Mock" by Gabe Hollombe. Pytest is a great alternative testing framework to unittest from the standard library. It often lets you get the same tests written with far fewer lines of code, and it has a cool dependency injection system to help you share common test dependencies while keeping your tests understandable. I'll tell you all about how to get basic unit testing done, and I'll show you how to use Voidspace's Mock library to test collaborations between your objects, too. Gabe is a full-stack senior engineer at Neo Innovation, with a thirst for knowledge and a passion for sharing what he's learned. He's had the pleasure of speaking on four different continents about JavaScript, Ruby, Vim, and HTML5 Game development. 2. "Developing real time applications in Django with Websockets " by Gerald Goh Utilising swampdragon , I'll be showing how to build a simple real time chat application in Django. Gerald is a full stack developer at Apvera Pte. Ltd., a security analytics startup. 3. "How to learn and be productive with Python3 in a week" by Chris Chris will talk about how you can go from knowing nothing of Python to being productive in a week. • Basic Python syntax and environment setup ( IDE, virtualenv ) • Data type • How to use libraries 4. "Three Python tips" by Martin Brochhaus We are hoping to repeat this talk with different speakers at the end of each meetup. Martin will make the start and give quick introductions to three basic Python tools that will make your life easier: * Virtualenv * Virtualenvwrapper * Flake8 Martin is the founder of Bitmazk Pte. Ltd., a Singapore based web development agency specialized on creating web apps with Python and Django. He is also part of the organizing committee for PyCon Singapore and an active member of Python User Group Singapore. 5. Alfred from PyCon APAC will talk about the upcoming APAC conference in Taiwan. -------------- Would you like to speak at this or a future meetups? You could share about your technology stack, how you solved a problem, your new library, or your opinions on best practices, so that people can get to know how awesome you are! 5 Python tips is a small segment at the end of meetup where you can share some things that make your Python life easier. A newly discovered core module, a library or some command line tool that makes your life better and/or easier. So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! For speaking please contact Björn, @gaqzi or <ba@sanitarium.se>, or Victor <icyisamu@gmail.com> See you all soon! -------------- Job Postings Are you looking for Pythonista? Do you have a job posting? Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. -------------- A big thank you to our venue sponsor ThoughtWorks!

events.name: talk.js

Scheduled Talks: Realtime remote monitoring fun with Node, Arduino and Socket.io - David Effendi Current state of WebVR and WebGL markup GLAM - Jia Hen Lightning Talks: PhoneGap: Create Mobile application with web development skill - Warat Wongmaneekit Be there at 7pm and we will start at 7:15pm. Venue sponsored by Microsoft. Location: One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989 Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. See you there!
